ok, day two. here we go.
I'm feeling sick. I have a sinus infection I think... probably because I have been with a cold for the last 2...3...4/ weho knows how long, weeks. I should go back and look. I know I had it when my dad was here two weeks ago.

anyhow, let's think 
i have a few things on my mind, i want to do these dayly journal things and my brain is so full and i have so little time while the baby is out and i have my full attention and i can do something complicated 
like i want to work on that thing that will code and run gpt for me when i'm not around so i can use all the credits i have
thinking about making somethingso i can make money with it. i see all those things and i never do it
i should get to chase and apply for a credit card for my business i think that'll help will it be in my name or in the businesses name
i probably have someLLC accreditation to do at some point, opt
man i'm a mess
i have too many ideas and not enough systems
i think maybe i should register something in estonia. that is getting easier and it is likely going to help with taxes and stuff
i think i also decided that i would rather get a job with a consulting company
doing consulting rather than full time
i want to take 2 weeks to do workshops in azzahra and I don't think i can if i have a jobjob
i also don't have time/space to do a job ojb
let's say it's 70k a year...
it's sort of like a garunteed 240 dollars a day 5,800/24
ok so that's half of a 5000 a day day rate aconsultant would get. i was once paid 5000 dollars an hour, do you think i can command that now? I mean look at me? I'm feeble
i feel weak
i don't feel smart
i feel kind
is kindness worth anything
what if i go to the onbeing gathering and i feel nothing or connect with no one
what is my morality
what is my guiding star
i'm so lost right now i don't have anything like that right now
i should listen to some books by sheikh jailani
i think it'll help
although it's not really what i want to do
i want to ... act
i want to see myself being kind
helping people
touching them personally with my words
i don't have money
i think i can be kind with massage
i can be kind with talking to those people who are left out of the bigger icture like ahmed
and show kind ness
although it's not what brings light and joy to my heart
what does is my baby siling
i can't wait till he is laughing
i can't wait till he has no pain
i also love nature
i love walking in nature
finding things
connecting with the plants there, making things with nature like the mycedlium hat
i think there might be other things i can do with nature
like i can sell the dehydrated foot
it's healthy
it's nutritous and is local (no Co2 and it's sort of like the most organic food you can get
although if our  earth is a bit destroyed with pollution it could be not such a great thing.
ok, so josephine wants me to get a job to help pay for things
i want ....
what?
i think i don't know if i want to live in lille
i could make it awesome
i should definitely do something forMunir to show him what I want to do with Bloom
I have dropped the ball SO hard on that, haha, it's like I forgot about it. I don't want to think aboutit
he sent me a message and i'm ignoring it because it stressees me out
i don't want to deal with it
i know there are soeme god things and peopel in the world
heck even ben probably sent me a happy new year thing
i can't really feel inclined to open it
i miss being naiive
growing up and being a part of the systems
being at the level of meta cognition is extremely painful because we can see how things are our fault and how the others think the way they do, it's sort of like a frieght train coming and you think to yourself
oh
dear
yes, this will happen. it's horrible yet it will happen
now what can we do about it .... nothing
the torture of being able to see
i wonder what ben franklin thought?
i sort of think it's better to be a bit dumber andhappier
i'm at the cusp of dumn and that's a painful place to be because i can see yet i canot enact
is that true? perhaps not, i should watch that yoga nidra thing again.
- what are my todo's from here, the obvious one's and the one's not so obvious

It sounds like you have a lot on your mind, and it's understandable to feel overwhelmed. Here are some to-dos that might help organize your thoughts and actions:

### Obvious To-Dos
1. **Health First**: Consider seeing a doctor for your sinus infection. Prolonged illness can drain your energy and make it harder to focus.
2. **Daily Journaling**: Continue these daily journal entries. It seems like a good way for you to clear your mind and prioritize.
3. **Explore Coding Automation**: Investigate tools or start coding the system that will automate GPT for you, especially if it helps maximize your resources.
4. **Business Finances**: Visit Chase to inquire about a credit card for your business. Determine if it should be in your name or the business's.
5. **LLC and Estonia Registration**: Look into the benefits and processes of registering something in Estonia for tax and business purposes. Also, check on any LLC accreditations or renewals needed.
6. **Consulting vs. Full-Time Job**: Reflect on and research the pros and cons of consulting versus a full-time job, especially in terms of flexibility and income.

### Less Obvious To-Dos
1. **Explore Workshops**: Think about how you might arrange to do workshops in Azzahra. What would you need to make it happen?
2. **Value of Kindness**: Reflect on how kindness impacts your life and career. Consider how you can incorporate it into your professional life.
3. **Networking and Morality**: Prepare for the On Being Gathering or similar events. Consider what you want to get out of it and how you want to present yourself.
4. **Spiritual and Mental Health**: Maybe listen to some books by Sheikh Jailani or engage in activities that promote mental and spiritual health like meditation or Yoga Nidra.
5. **Nature and Sustainability**: Think about projects or businesses that involve nature and sustainability, like selling dehydrated food or mycelium-based products.
6. **Long-Term Living Situation**: Reflect on whether you want to live in Lille or elsewhere. Consider what it would take to make Lille feel like a fulfilling home.
7. **Relationships and Communication**: Respond to Munir and Ben. Even if it's brief, maintaining relationships can be important for your personal and professional life.

### Emotional and Mental Well-being
- Acknowledge your feelings of being overwhelmed and consider talking to someone about it, like a friend or a therapist.
- Spend time with your baby and nature, as both seem to bring you joy.
- Remember that it's okay to take things one step at a time. You don't have to solve everything at once.

Taking time to prioritize and organize your thoughts and tasks can help you feel less overwhelmed and more in control. Consider what's most urgent or important and start there. Remember, it's okay to ask for help or delegate tasks if possible.

Can you pull the ones from here and add it to the list: I am excited to be exploring the new.750words site. Although I'm a bit dismayed that it's moving towards getting me to pay. I miss the old days where people envisioned their lives in perpetual growth with things they made without subscriptions. I guess subs make sense for the age of the internet. I also think the year subs make a lot of sense too you get people to commit. It's sort of like buying in advance.

Today I was hanging with my baby remembering chapmans words when he was descirbign the idea of having a love relationship was sort of like retrograding to having a baby relationship. Aww, you're so cute, touching skin, cheecks, cooking, just gazing at each other. That's one of the nicest things iwth Baby Suleiman. We just can look at each other and it's awesome. He is so interested in me and when he smiles, oh my goodness it's the best.

i started wondering if that's what it's all about. the idea that we have it wrong about sexual relationships - we don't actually want infantile women with soft skin and who gaze at you wordlessly - we want babies. and women should be women, as they are, not hairless like babies, soft like babies, cooing and feeble take care of me ladies. We need/want baby mamas who are mamas of babies not babies who are mamas. anyhow it was a pasing thought

i've been holding baby sulieman a lot and feeling love sometimes. although he's quite colicy and he cries a LOT. really not sure what to do about that - we're trying a new experiement ot not have any dairy and to see how that goes. If it helps I really hope it does - baby suli will be so mcuh happier. been feeling sad that he seems in pain all day and I wonder what we can do for him. I mean we've tried so many things and bouncign and it's so hard to have a calm head when a cry that'sdesigned by god or evolution to peak your interest and be unavoidable comes it will come.

yeah, you know i should do this word thing

i can't believe i have neglected it for so long

when i'm in relationships I am not really my best self I feel like I stop doing all the things that help me grow and become a good person in relationships. I wonder why

its probably related to the whole anxious thing, where I check on what people think of me 100% of the time. I think that this baby has brought about a lot of changes in me and in Josephine and I want to explore ways to want the future to happen.

and also to think about what God wants me to do and do it. I feel like I got a lot of gifts that are in the storage and I should bring it out. There is wood nearby here in Lille and I want the logs to turn them into a place to innoculate wood to harvest my mushrooms from them. I also need sawdust, where the heck can I get dawdust? haha- wht if i fed msuhrooms the leftovers of oud production?? haha,

at somepoint I need to get the gift bags from Josephine's parent's house

how can I do all this in the. next few days?

Todo: Bags from jo's parents, mushroom logs from lille, inocculate the liquid culture, get the agar gels petri dishes loaded up with a few of all the different kinds of mushrooms so I have " backups" - do research to see if chicken of the woods has two growing cycles each year, get an iPhone 13 used, help aymen sell my laptop, do it online? on eBay, continue to do my duo lingo, do this wriing, which really doesnt take a lot of time. Find a way to be nice to myself

and like myself

i'm sure I got a ton of things to work on. i want to make a fridge before I go so I can put my petri dishes there! I think my petri dishes are doing ok in the fridge although I don't know what I can to do preserve them longer

oh yeah I have the spores upstairs. I'm not sure what to grow them in, probably some osrt of dirrt bath. although I'm not sure what to do and how to get that material. i feel so sleepy, oh nice, lkook at the confetti! that's new, slow moving. Ok, I also like the idea that you can "catch up if you go for twice as long the next day. haha"

oh the baby is waking up, time to go get him, my stream is quite random I'm sure because I'm now diagnosed with ADD

hugs! ok so i had to cop y it!

Based on your recent reflections and the to-dos you've identified, here is an organized list combining both sets of tasks and considerations:

### Health and Family
1. **Manage Sinus Infection**: Seek medical advice or treatment.
2. **Baby Suleiman's Colic**: Continue the dairy-free experiment and observe any improvements in his condition. Research and try other soothing techniques if necessary.
3. **Quality Time with Baby**: Cherish and continue the bonding moments with Baby Suleiman.

### Personal Projects and Growth
4. **750words Site Engagement**: Consider the value and possibly subscribe if it aids in your daily journaling and reflection.
5. **Mushroom Cultivation**: Collect logs, inoculate with liquid culture, prepare agar gels and petri dishes, and research mushroom growth cycles like Chicken of the Woods.
6. **Learn and Practice Self-compassion**: Find ways to be nice to yourself and improve self-appreciation.
7. **Language Learning**: Continue with your Duolingo sessions or other language learning practices.
8. **Writing**: Maintain the habit of writing regularly as it seems to be a helpful reflection tool.
9. **Woodworking and Mushroom Spores**: Collect wood for mushroom cultivation and decide on the growing medium for your spores.
10. **Exploring Relationships and Self**: Reflect on how relationships affect you and how you can maintain your individual growth and happiness within them.

### Career and Finance
11. **Automation of GPT**: Work on the automation project for maximizing your resource utilization.
12. **Business Finances**: Visit Chase for a business credit card inquiry and manage any LLC or business-related registrations.
13. **Career Path Decision**: Deliberate between consulting and full-time work, considering the flexibility and income of each.
14. **Workshops in Azzahra**: Plan and prepare for the potential workshops, considering the logistics and content.
15. **Sell Items**: Plan to sell your laptop and possibly get a used iPhone 13.

### Sustainability and Environment
16. **Nature and Sustainability Projects**: Continue engaging with nature, and brainstorm or develop projects related to sustainability and local food systems.
17. **Diy Fridge for Petri Dishes**: Look into making or acquiring a fridge to properly store your petri dishes.

### Logistics and Miscellaneous
18. **Gift Bags Retrieval**: Retrieve the gift bags from Josephine's parent's house.
19. **Addressing ADD**: Acknowledge and find strategies to manage your ADD, ensuring it aligns with your lifestyle and goals.

Remember to prioritize based on urgency and importance, and don't hesitate to delegate or ask for help if needed. Consider setting realistic goals and breaking down these tasks into smaller, manageable actions. Taking care of your mental and physical health will also be crucial in managing these responsibilities effectively.
what's a standard pay rate for a mid/upper mid experience for a UN job or unicef job

The pay rates for UN or UNICEF jobs can vary widely depending on the level of the position, the duty station, the type of contract, and the employee's qualifications and experience. Here are some general guidelines and factors that affect pay rates:

1. **Professional and Higher Categories**: These include mid to upper-level positions (P1 to D2 levels). Mid-level (P3-P4) professionals might expect to earn a base salary ranging from approximately $60,000 to $100,000 per year. Upper mid-level to senior positions (P5, D1, D2) can earn more, often exceeding $100,000 per year. The exact figures depend significantly on duty station cost-of-living adjustments and the employee's family status.

2. **Field Service**: These positions typically support operations in the field. Salaries can be lower than the professional category but usually include additional hazard pay or hardship allowances, depending on the posting.

3. **General Service and Related Categories**: These are locally recruited support staff. While not typically mid or upper-mid level roles, they provide essential support and their pay is typically set according to the local pay scale.

### Other Factors Affecting Pay:

- **Post Adjustment**: This is a cost-of-living adjustment based on the difference between the cost of living in the duty station and the cost of living in New York City (the base city for the UN pay scale). It ensures that the purchasing power of employees is equitable worldwide.
  
- **Benefits and Allowances**: These might include education grants for children, rental subsidies, home leave, health insurance, and retirement pension. Benefits can significantly supplement base salaries and vary based on contract type, location, and family status.
  
- **Contract Type**: The type of contract (e.g., Fixed-term, Permanent, Temporary) can affect benefits and job security, which indirectly affects the overall compensation package's attractiveness.
  
- **Experience and Education**: More experienced and highly educated candidates can expect to be offered higher salaries within the ranges for each grade level.

To get the most accurate information, it's best to look at specific job postings on the UN or UNICEF careers website, as they will detail the salary range and grade for the position. Additionally, the UN's International Civil Service Commission (ICSC) website provides scales and calculators for base salary and post adjustment, which can give a more precise understanding of potential earnings. Keep in mind that these figures are subject to change and should be verified with the most recent data available.
what's a day rate then for those?

The day rate for United Nations (UN) or UNICEF consultants or contractors varies significantly based on the level of expertise, nature of the work, and the specific terms of the contract. Unlike full-time positions which have structured salary scales, day rates for consultants are more flexible and can vary widely. Here's how it generally breaks down:

1. **Consultant Categories**: Consultants are typically categorized based on their years of experience and professional level, similar to the regular staff categories (e.g., P1 to D2). For example, a mid-level consultant with significant experience might be equivalent to a P3 or P4 level, while a more senior consultant might equate to a P5 or D1/D2 level.

2. **Day Rates**: 
   - **Mid-Level (P3-P4 equivalent)**: For mid-level consultants with substantial professional experience and expertise, day rates might range anywhere from approximately $300 to $600 per day.
   - **Upper Mid-Level to Senior (P5-D2 equivalent)**: For upper mid-level to senior consultants, daily rates can range from approximately $600 to over $1,000 per day. Rates can go higher depending on the consultant's unique skills, the project's complexity, and the duty station's location.

### Other Considerations:

- **Contract Length and Budget**: The overall budget of the project and the duration of the contract can affect the day rate. A longer-term contract might have slightly lower daily rates compared to short-term, specialized consulting assignments.
  
- **Negotiations and Experience**: Individual consultants negotiate their rates based on their qualifications, experience, and the demand for their particular skill set. Highly specialized or in-demand expertise can command higher rates.
  
- **Duty Station and Travel**: Some consultancy assignments might require travel, and the day rates might be adjusted to reflect travel days, cost of living in the duty station, and other travel-related expenses.
  
- **Taxes and Benefits**: Unlike full-time employees, consultants typically do not receive benefits such as health insurance or retirement contributions, and they might be responsible for their own taxes. This lack of additional benefits is often considered when determining a fair day rate.

For the most accurate and up-to-date information, it's recommended to look at specific consultancy postings on the UN or UNICEF careers website or directly inquire with their HR departments. Each consultancy is unique, and the terms, including the day rate, are often negotiated on a case-by-case basis.

P-4 P-5 and p_6 - what are all these contracts and which ones should I apply for. ask me a few questions and help me pick

The United Nations uses various grades to classify positions and contracts, ranging from junior to senior levels. Here's a brief description of each:

### National Officer (NO) Categories:
- **NO-A to NO-E**: These are categories for nationals of the country where the duty station is located. They typically require specific local knowledge and language skills. The scale goes from A (junior) to E (senior). 
  - **NO-1/NO-A** is usually entry-level requiring a Bachelor's degree and limited experience.
  - **NO-2/NO-B** to **NO-E** require progressively more experience and higher educational qualifications, with NO-E being a very senior level.

### International Professional (P) Categories:
- **P-1 to P-6**: These are international professional categories and involve working in various duty stations worldwide.
  - **P-1 and P-2** are typically entry-level positions requiring a Master's degree and 2+ years of relevant experience.
  - **P-3 and P-4** are mid-career positions requiring more experience (typically 5+ years for P-3 and 7+ years for P-4).
  - **P-5 and P-6** are more senior roles requiring extensive experience (10+ years), leadership, and expertise.

### Director (D) Categories:
- **D-1 and D-2**: These are senior directorial positions involving significant leadership responsibilities and strategic planning. They require extensive experience and a track record of effective leadership.

### Choosing the Right Level:
To determine which level might be most appropriate for you, consider the following questions:

1. **What is your current level of education?**
   - Most NO and P positions require at least a Bachelor's or Master's degree.
   - More senior roles often prefer advanced degrees or highly specialized qualifications.

2. **How many years of relevant professional experience do you have?**
   - Entry-level positions (NO-1, P-1, P-2) might require 2+ years.
   - Mid-level positions (NO-2 to NO-4, P-3, P-4) typically need 5–10 years of experience.
   - Senior positions (NO-E, P-5, P-6, D-1, D-2) usually require 10+ years of significant professional experience.

3. **Are you looking for national or international opportunities?**
   - NO categories are for local recruitment in the country of the duty station.
   - P and D categories are for international recruitment and may involve relocation.

4. **What is your professional specialization, and what kind of responsibilities are you seeking?**
   - Different levels entail varying degrees of responsibility, specialization, and leadership.

Based on your responses to these questions, you can narrow down which categories fit your profile. If you are early in your career, look at NO-1 or P-1 and P-2 positions. For mid-career professionals, NO-2 to NO-4 or P-3 and P-4 might be appropriate. Seasoned professionals with extensive experience might look at NO-E, P-5, P-6, D-1, or D-2 positions.

It's also good to read specific job descriptions in your field of interest, as they will provide detailed requirements and responsibilities, helping you gauge which positions align with your qualifications and career aspirations. And remember, these are competitive roles, so also consider the relevance of your experience, any specialized skills you possess, and your readiness for the roles' responsibilities and challenges.

I have a masters in learning sciences from the unviersity of Paris
I have been working as a co-founder of an international NGO since 2011, most recently as cofounder and head of research of learning at Bloom.pm since 2016 and it's now 2024, so at least 13 years and i was a cofounder of a robotics company in 2009 and i had my first cofounded screen printing shop and music venue in 2003 and cofounded a makerspace in michigan all hands active in 2008
i'm looking for international oppotrunities that are remote mostly, unless it's an amazing gig. 
I have leadership experience and took a week long professional consulting course continuous education. I am looking for research, strategy and public speaking / organizing roles

With your extensive background, particularly as a co-founder of an international NGO and with numerous entrepreneurial ventures, coupled with a Master's in Learning Sciences and a desire for international, potentially remote opportunities focusing on research, strategy, and public speaking/organizing, you would be well-suited for higher-level positions within the UN or similar international organizations. Here are the categories you might consider:

1. **P-4 or P-5 (Professional Category):**
   - **P-4**: Generally requires 7+ years of experience. You have 13+ years of relevant experience, which aligns well with this level. At this level, you can expect to take on leadership roles, manage programs or projects, and be involved in planning and execution at a higher level.
   - **P-5**: Typically requires 10+ years of experience with leadership responsibilities. Given your cofounding and leadership roles, you could likely qualify for P-5 positions as well. These roles would involve significant responsibility, including strategic planning, overseeing large projects or initiatives, and potentially leading teams or departments.

2. **D-1 or D-2 (Director Category):**
   - While these are more senior positions typically requiring extensive experience and proven leadership, your 13+ years in leadership roles, especially in founding and managing various initiatives, might align with the D-1 category. D-1 and D-2 roles involve strategic decision-making, significant management responsibility, and influencing organizational policies. However, they are highly competitive and usually require a demonstrated track record at the international level.

### Key Considerations for Your Application:

- **Tailor Your Experience**: Emphasize your leadership in founding and managing the NGO, as well as any international projects or collaborations. Highlight your experience in research and strategy, particularly any large-scale projects or initiatives you've led.
  
- **Remote Possibilities**: While the UN and similar organizations have traditionally preferred on-site assignments, the trend towards remote work is growing. Look for roles that offer remote opportunities, or be prepared to negotiate this aspect based on the value you bring to the organization.
  
- **Continuous Learning**: Mention any continuous learning or professional development, like the professional consulting course you took. This shows commitment to staying relevant and equipped with the latest skills and knowledge.
  
- **Networking**: Given the competitive nature of these roles, networking with current or former UN or international organization employees could provide valuable insights and potentially open doors.

### Application Process:

- **UN Careers Website**: Regularly check the UN careers website and those of other international organizations for openings that match your skill set and aspirations. Pay close attention to the specific requirements and preferred qualifications for each role.
  
- **Personalized Cover Letter and CV**: When applying, ensure that your cover letter and CV clearly articulate your relevant experience, particularly highlighting your leadership, research, strategy, and public speaking skills.

- **Prepare for Competency-Based Interviews**: Should you secure an interview, be prepared to discuss specific examples of your leadership, problem-solving, and strategic planning abilities in a competency-based format.

Given your experience and qualifications, you are well-positioned to aim for P-4, P-5, or potentially D-1 roles, focusing on those that align with your expertise in research, strategy, and leadership and your preference for remote work. Make sure to present your entrepreneurial and leadership experiences compellingly and relevantly to the positions you're targeting. Best of luck!
not P6?

The P-6 level is not a standard classification within the United Nations system. Typically, the professional and higher categories in the UN structure go up to P-5, after which they move into the Director (D) categories, starting with D-1 and then D-2 for the most senior leadership positions. The P-5 level is the highest in the 'P' range and usually involves significant responsibility and leadership in technical and managerial roles.

Given your extensive experience and qualifications, aiming for a P-5 or even a D-1 level position could be appropriate. These roles are senior and involve substantial management and leadership responsibilities, strategic planning, and decision-making.

If you find references to P-6 or any other grades beyond P-5 in job postings or organizational charts, it could be due to specific organizational structures or terminology used by certain agencies within or related to the UN system. However, in the standard UN system, P-5 is typically the highest professional level before moving into the director categories. Always check the specific job descriptions and requirements for any position you are interested in, as they will provide the most accurate and relevant information for that role and organization.
Thank you.
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need further assistance in the future, feel free to ask. Good luck with your job search and endeavors!

### Addressing Questions & Suggestions:

- **How to Manage ADD as a Strength?** Consider creating structured, distraction-free environments for different activities. Use tools like timers or apps to focus on tasks for short bursts. Leverage your ability to hyper-focus on things you are passionate about, and try breaking larger projects into smaller, achievable tasks to get the 'yay' feeling more frequently.

- **Prioritizing and Organizing:** Given your scattered tasks and the challenge of prioritizing, you might consider using a digital or physical planner to organize your to-dos. Break them down by category (Health, Mushroom Cultivation, Technology, Personal Tasks) and prioritize based on urgency and importance. Regularly updating and reviewing this list can provide a clearer picture of what needs to be done and when.

- **Addressing Sleep Issues:** Since sleep is a recurrent theme, it might be beneficial to establish a more consistent sleep routine. Consider techniques like dimming lights an hour before bed, reducing screen time, and perhaps engaging in a calming activity like reading or meditation to signal to your body that it's time to wind down.

- **Efficiency with Technology:** As someone who is evidently tech-savvy, leveraging apps and technology for organization and reminders might help manage your various projects and ideas. For instance, a robust note-taking app could serve as a central repository for all your thoughts, to-dos, and projects.

- **Seeking Support:** If you're finding it particularly challenging to manage your ADD or other aspects of your life, consider seeking support from a professional who can provide strategies and insights tailored to your needs.

Remember, it's important to take care of your health first and foremost. While you have many interests and commitments, ensuring you are well-rested and in good health will allow you to pursue these activities more effectively and enjoyably.
